destinations.title: Cape Coast Castle
destinations.history: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Cape Coast Castle was a major hub during the transatlantic slave trade.
destinations.highlights: Explore the dungeons, the Door of No Return, and the museum.
destinations.tips: Guided tours are available; visit early to avoid crowds.

destinations.title: Kakum National Park
destinations.history: Established in 1992, this park protects a tropical rainforest.
destinations.highlights: Walk the famous canopy walkway 30 meters above the forest floor.
destinations.tips: Wear comfortable shoes; the canopy walk takes about an hour.

destinations.title: Mole National Park
destinations.history: Ghana’s largest wildlife refuge, founded in 1958.
destinations.highlights: Spot elephants, antelopes, and over 300 bird species on a safari.
destinations.tips: Best visited during the dry season (December to April).

destinations.title: Elmina Castle
destinations.history: Built by the Portuguese in 1482, Elmina Castle is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the oldest European buildings in sub-Saharan Africa. Explore its haunting dungeons and learn about its role in the transatlantic slave trade.
destinations.highlights: Stunning ocean views from the castle ramparts.
destinations.tips: Hire a local guide for the best experience.

destinations.title: Larabanga Mosque
destinations.history: Known as the “Mecca of West Africa,” this 15th-century mosque is Ghana’s oldest and one of West Africa’s most ancient. Its unique Sudano-Sahelian architecture is a must-see.
destinations.highlights: Rare chance to view a centuries-old Qur’an.
destinations.tips: Guided tours are available; visit early to avoid crowds.

destinations.name: Wli Waterfall
destinations.history: Ghana's highest waterfall, nestled in lush greenery, offers a refreshing escape. Hike to the upper and lower falls for breathtaking views and a chance to spot bats in nearby caves.
destinations.highlights: Swim in the cool plunge pool.
destinations.visitorTips: Guided tours are available; visit early to avoid crowds.

destinations.name: Mount Afadja (Afadjato)
destinations.history: At 885m, Ghana's highest peak offers a rewarding hike with panoramic views of Volta Lake, forests, and villages. Over 300 butterfly species and 33 mammals thrive here.
destinations.visitorTips: Wear comfortable shoes; it is quite a walk.

destinations.name: Eli Beach Resort
destinations.history: A perfect coastal getaway with pristine beaches, water sports, and vibrant nightlife.
destinations.visitorTips: Best visited during the dry season (December to April).

destinations.name: Lakeside Marine Entertainment Park
destinations.history: Featuring a 600m² splash pool, aquarium, and clubhouse, this park offers fun for all ages. Host events or unwind in a vibrant, safe setting.
destinations.visitorTips: Best visited during the dry season (December to April).

destinations.name: Treasure Island, Ada
destinations.history: This serene island on the Volta River is ideal for water sports, fishing, and relaxation. Its eco-friendly vibe makes it one of Ghana's finest escapes.
destinations.visitorTips: Best visited during the dry season (December to April).
